humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient had invasive lobular carcinoma that measured 5.5 cm in greatest dimension. Based on the rules provided, a tumor of this size would be classified as T3 (more than 5 cm). This is consistent with the pathologic staging provided in the report (pT3). The presence of lobular carcinoma in situ and negative lymphovascular invasion do not affect the T stage. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor size is reported as 5.5 cm, which falls in the T3 category (tumor size >5 cm) according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for breast cancer.
